section.title: Preparing
section.p:
- JManage requires JDK 1.4+ to build and run. You can download JDK here.
- Ant 1.6.1 is used to build JManage. You can download ant here.
- Get the JManage source tree from cvs.sourceforge.net. Windows developer can setup WinCVS as described in this document.
<jmanage-home> in this document refers to c:\cvsroot\main, where c:\cvsroot is you CVS root.

section.title: Building
section.p:
- Make sure that JAVA_HOME and ANT_HOME environment variables are properly set.
- Run "ant" from <jmanage-home> directory to create the build. This builds core jManage classes.
- To compile all modules (e.g. weblogic, jboss, etc.) run "ant build-all-modules". The weblogic module requires weblogic.jar to be copied to the "ext" folder.
- You can run one of the following targets to build individual modules:
build-jboss-module
build-jsr160-module
build-tomcat-module
build-weblogic-module

section.title: Running
section.p:
- Execute startup script from <jmanage-home>. Enter "123456" as the password. jManage runs on port 9090 by default.
- Point your browser to http://localhost:9090/index.jsp. Use "admin" as the username and "123456" as the password.
